text.p: - The Slovenian government said on Thursday it would provide an additional 200 million tolars ($1.4 million) for the development of the troubled Maribor region.
- Prime Minister Janez Drnovsek on Thursday opened a three-day economic conference in Bled hosting representatives from EFTA (European Free Trade Agreement) member states, Asia and Russia.
- Representatives of 18 Slovenian and 42 Chinese companies met in Shanghai on Thursday to discuss trade cooperation.
- Heavy rains in north and northeastern parts of Slovenia has caused floods and landslides.
- The city council of Ljubljana decided on Thursday to ban the city's power plant from using Slovenian coal, because of its high sulphur content.
- SCT Olimpija lost against greek AEK by 0-2 in Thursday's second round match of the cup winners' cup.
- A total of 1,307 candidates will contest 88 seats in parliamentary elections scheduled for November 10.
- Slovenian doctors' union FIDES said on Thursday it was considering a strike because the parliament failed to pass a new law determining doctors' salaries .
- The national radio and television station said on Thursday its losses in 1996 reached 1.3 billion tolars ($9.35 million).
